content.description:
Transience traverses good edges and finishes with a weird topout.

Sit start with hands matched on the obvious jug. From there, traverse right using an edge and sharp edges, then throw a foot onto the relief, grab the sidepull, once on the huge shelf. I just walked around for the top out.

A direct topout, versus continuing out right, would add greatly to the difficulty.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work fine, it's a definite lowball and the landing is great.
content.location: It climbs the southwest arete of Battlement Boulder.

content.description:
Ring Them Bells is a one-move wonder that finishes with a technical topout.

Sit start with an okay, left hand, three finger pocket and a very good, right hand three finger pocket. From there, make a huge move to a left hand, shark tooth (crux?), match a right hand next to the left on a small edge, then negotiate the sloping bumps slightly to the right, work the feet up and mantle (crux?) for the topout.
content.protection: A pad or two will do, the landing is perfect.
content.location: It climbs the west face of Battlement Boulder.
